cobblemon.species.creeplett.name: Creeplett
cobblemon.species.creeplett.desc1: For as scary as it's not catchable counterpart can be- Creeplett shows next to no aggression.
cobblemon.species.creeplett.desc2: Creeplett's spores can travel for long distances after exploding. This has lead to Creeplett having adapted to almost every environment it can grow in.
cobblemon.species.skybe.name: Skybe
cobblemon.species.skybe.desc1: This strange Pokemon flies high above the sky, giving saplings to all trainers it sees.
cobblemon.species.skybe.desc2: Legend says that long ago, a man built an empire on the back of a giant Skybe.
cobblemon.species.creeperator.name: Creeperator
cobblemon.species.creeperator.desc1: During evolution the core in Creepletts chest grows neary 4 times the size.
cobblemon.species.creeperator.desc2: Due to how unstable Creeperator is there have been rumors that caught specimens will sometimes explode in their Poke-balls.
cobblemon.species.endisite.name: Endisite
cobblemon.species.endisite.desc1: It's unknown how these little bug types come to be. Many unverified reports say they come from Ender Pearls.
cobblemon.species.endisite.desc2: These are a pest to those who live or work in The End. There was once a time where thousands of them would litter on End islands.
cobblemon.species.enderran.name: Enderran
cobblemon.species.enderran.desc1: Despite how slow they move, their ability to teleport and their unmatched reaction speed makes them pretty hard to track.
cobblemon.species.enderran.desc2: Enderran often steals blocks and items for fun. Nobody knows where they take them.
cobblemon.species.lizkul.name: Lizkul
cobblemon.species.lizkul.desc1: People who live in caves often use these as companions due to their amazing hearing and sense of direction.
cobblemon.species.lizkul.desc2: Lizkul love echo shards. Getting an echo shard may be dangerous, but it's a gift your Lizkul will never forget.
cobblemon.species.lizarrden.name: Lizarrden
cobblemon.species.lizarrden.desc1: When encountering a Lizarrden, be sure to stand still. Despite its giant eye, it seemingly cant see you if you arent moving.
cobblemon.species.lizarrden.desc2: Rumored to be completely blind. It never seems to check the same place twice.
cobblemon.species.withrose.name: Withrose
cobblemon.species.withrose.desc1: A trainer once nurtured a Wither Rose for years, making sure the soil was perfect and watering it every day. That Rose grew into Withrose.
cobblemon.species.withrose.desc2: Withrose wont let you hold it unless iy deems you a friend. Attempting to hold an unwilling Withrose will result in being given Wither.
cobblemon.species.allayze.name: Allayze
cobblemon.species.allayze.desc1: The go-to partner Pokemon for many trainers. Not only is it versatile but it will always be willing to help with just about anything.
cobblemon.species.allayze.desc2: They are spirits of good and therefore will not fight in a battle it deems immoral.
cobblemon.species.vexace.name: Vexace
cobblemon.species.vexace.desc1: After exposing Allyze to a Totem of Undying, it grows into a Spirit of Justice. It will fight against anyone and anything that wronged its trainer.
cobblemon.species.vexace.desc2: Illigers often use Vexace due to its powerful attacks and blindness to good and evil.
cobblemon.species.fortraze.name: Fortraze
cobblemon.species.fortraze.desc1: After exposing Allayze to a Blaze Rod, it grows into a Spirit of Guidance. It will defend any creature it sees as innocent.
cobblemon.species.fortraze.desc2: They will patrol the Nether Fortess looking for Pokemon and Trainers to protect from the horrors of the Nether.
cobblemon.species.hurrilay.name: Hurrilay
cobblemon.species.hurrilay.desc1: After exposing Allayze to a Phantom Membrane, it grows into a Spirit of Judgement. If it deems you evil it will sweep your home away in a gaint hurricane.
cobblemon.species.hurrilay.desc2: Hurrilay judges by its own standards. Different hurrilay have different standards for good and evil.
cobblemon.species.ranabyss.name: Ranabyss
cobblemon.species.ranabyss.desc1: A strange Pokemon known to be the last of her kind. The mud she's made of has traces of bedrock mixed into it.
cobblemon.species.ranabyss.desc2: it's rumored that her appearance is that of her first trainer. This also explains why training Ranabyss is so difficult.
cobblemon.species.chargingboom.name: Chargin Boom
cobblemon.species.chargingboom.desc1: Aggressive and dangerous, Chargin' Boom was first discovered as fossils for what we believe to be an ancient relative to Creeplett.
cobblemon.species.chargingboom.desc2: Recently, Chargin' Boom has been found eating the newly ressurected Torch Flower.
cobblemon.species.ironhelper.name: Iron Helper
cobblemon.species.ironhelper.desc1: First reports of Iron Helper happened after a strange wirring sound rung throughout the overworld.
cobblemon.species.ironhelper.desc2: Even though rare, some people have reported Iron Helper being able to speak. Any attemps to document this have lead to no results.
cobblemon.species.qwilprism.name: Qwilprism
cobblemon.species.qwilprism.desc1: These seem to be the result of Qwilfish adapting to the Ancient Monuments found underwater.
cobblemon.species.qwilprism.desc2: Gaurdians do not attack them despite being able to scan creatures to see what they are.
cobblemon.species.elderqwil.name: Elderqwil
cobblemon.species.elderqwil.desc1: Said to come about when Qwilprism are shot by stray Gaurdian beams.
cobblemon.species.elderqwil.desc2: Despite Qwilprism not having any Gaurdian abilities, Elderqwil displays nearly all of them.
cobblemon.species.witherich.name: Witherich
cobblemon.species.witherich.desc1: In the ancient times, many recount the Wither having a similar looking Pokemon following it around.
cobblemon.species.witherich.desc2: It is thought that the Wither might have been an ancient trainer corrupted by the magic fo Witherrich.
cobblemon.species.shulkle.name: Shulkle
cobblemon.species.shulkle.desc1: A convergeant form of Shuckle. It uses shed Shulker shells as protection.
cobblemon.species.shulkle.desc2: Shulkers and Shulkle both seem to understand one another. If you are lucky you might see them talking to each other.
cobblemon.species.phantomare.name: Phantomare
cobblemon.species.phantomare.desc1: Phantomare is thought to come into being by the nightmares of people struggling with sleep deprivation.
cobblemon.species.phantomare.desc2: Studies show that they look almost exactly like sketched out hallucinations many see when pulling back-to-back all nighters.
cobblemon.species.patterler.name: Patterler
cobblemon.species.patterler.desc1: A little bundle of joy that loves running around Lava Lakes. It will get sad if you dont jump in the lava to swim with it.
cobblemon.species.patterler.desc2: They need to be kept really warm. The temperature even being slightly below 70 degrees fahrenheit could cause Patterler to get sick.
cobblemon.species.strideler.name: Strideler
cobblemon.species.strideler.desc1: These grumpy looking Pokemon love walking across lava lakes and rivers.
cobblemon.species.strideler.desc2: If you're lucky, Stridler will allow you to hitch a ride across the Nether. But be wary that they decide when you get off.
cobblemon.species.weeplee.name: Weeplee
cobblemon.species.weeplee.desc1: A spirit of sadness. They arent as powerful as Allayze nor as agressive as a Ghast but yet, they seem to be related to both.
cobblemon.species.weeplee.desc2: Weeplee cries even when they are happy or angry. Trainers have to understand their body language in order to know if something is wrong.
cobblemon.species.enderdrake.name: Enderdrake
cobblemon.species.enderdrake.desc1: Hatched from the Dragon Egg, this little Ender Dragon aims to be your new best friend.
cobblemon.species.enderdrake.desc2: It acts more like a dog than a lizard. Normally cheery, it sometimes looks down at the void with a sad or fearful look.
cobblemon.species.petrelly.name: Petrelly
cobblemon.species.petrelly.desc1: One of the strangest Pokemon in the Craft-dex. Found in both swamps and basalt deltas you'd assume they are different or convergeant Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.petrelly.desc2: Despite the visual difference they act the exact same, have the same moves, abilities, and typing. It's a mystery how Pretrelly got to the Nether.
cobblemon.species.retmatism.name: Retmatism
cobblemon.species.retmatism.desc1: This Ultra-Beast seems to be drawn to unique or powerful metals. Leaving Netherrite out in an open biome like the Plains may draw it out.
cobblemon.species.retmatism.desc2: The two heads act as one and are entirely co-dependant despite being seperate entities. Seperating one causes the other to go into a frenzy.
